name: Limehills
description: Limehills is a full-service digital agency delivering branding, product design, web and software development, cloud services, and data and AI solutions. We help startups and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) build memorable, high-performance, and secure digital products.

branding.summary: Brand strategy, visual identity, naming, and brand guidelines.

web_and_software.summary: Custom web applications, single-page applications, and backend systems built with modern stacks.

mobile.summary: Cross-platform and native mobile apps for iOS and Android.

cloud_solutions.summary: Cloud architecture, migrations, and managed infrastructure on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.

cybersecurity.summary: Security assessments, vulnerability testing, and continuous monitoring.

devops.summary: CI/CD pipelines, automation, IaC and release engineering.

data_ai.summary: Data analytics, reporting, and machine learning solutions to drive insights and automation.

application_consulting.summary: Platform integrations and consulting for tools like Jira, Shopify, WordPress, and WooCommerce.

commonQuestions.a: We offer branding, web & software development, mobile apps, cloud solutions, cybersecurity, DevOps, data & AI, and platform consulting (Shopify, WordPress, Jira, etc.).

commonQuestions.q: How much does a project cost?
commonQuestions.a: Costs depend on scope, complexity, and timeline. Typical small websites start around $5k–$15k, mid-size apps range from $25k–$100k, and enterprise systems are quoted per requirements. We provide a free project scoping call to give an accurate estimate.
Discovery -> Design -> Development -> QA -> Launch -> Support. We emphasize incremental delivery and frequent demos so stakeholders see progress early.

commonQuestions.q: How long will my project take?
commonQuestions.a: Timelines vary. A brochure website: 2–6 weeks. A complex web app or mobile app: 3–6 months. Enterprise platform work: depends on integrations and compliance needs.
Yes — we can sign NDAs before discovery and work that requires confidentiality.

commonQuestions.q: How do you handle support and maintenance?
commonQuestions.a: We offer monthly maintenance plans and ad-hoc support. Maintenance covers security updates, small improvements, and monitoring. We can also run SLA-backed support for critical systems.

process.discovery: We run stakeholder interviews, requirements workshops, and technical audits to establish scope and success metrics.
process.design: UX and visual design with interactive prototypes for stakeholder feedback.
process.development: Agile sprints, continuous integration, automated testing, and incremental releases.
process.qa_and_launch: Thorough QA, performance tuning, and a staged launch with rollback plans.
process.post_launch: Monitoring, analytics, optimizations, and optional ongoing support or managed services.
